p: Studies suggest that the flavivirus neuropathogenesis is related to the apoptosis of infected neuronal cells and/or the immune response generated by the cells of the immune system, as microglia that can produce and release factors that may be toxic to neurons [34], [36]. Souza et al. [37] studying DENV 3 neurovirulence in mice found that increased levels of nitric oxide synthase 2 could be the cause of the death as it correlates with increased NOS2 and cytokine expression and virus in brain. In NOS2 –/– mice no clinical signs of infection were observed and cytokines were expressed at low levels, with the exception of interferon- γ [37].
